intro: Psorospermum fanerana, commonly known as the broad-leaved psorospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Psorospermum fanerana is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
